head.supplied: Brisbane ¶ July 7. 1872 ¶ Dear Sir. ¶ ¶ I enclose you my very indifferent example of ¶ Hypoloeuce exsulca ¶ RBr. ¶ ♀ ¶ , ¶ and also ¶ Anasthsia prolifera ¶ , ¶ Carpha alpina RBr. ¶ ¶ Scleria ...

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: RB MSS M51, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne.

Bot names to check.
MS found in folder of Spiculaea irritabilis. there is no MEL number.
Brisbane

I enclose you my very indifferent example of Hypoloeuce exsulca RBr. ♀,
uses here the symbol for 'female'.
and also Anasthsia prolifera , Carpha alpina RBr.
Scleria rugosa , Rastis monocephalus , Rastis fascicu latus & Rhyncosposa longiseta which are all authentic. Rastis monocephalus I named no doubt by inadvertence from memory R. capitatus. Also an arthrochilus , which I sent to Kew three or four years since, and named A. culiciformis though foliosus would be a better specific name, if the thing is really distinct from your Ar: irritabilis , which is not rare near Brisbane, but I have never been able to find another example of the first — When I saw it, I supposed it to be a new genus, and named it Arthrochilus , not knowing you had anticipated me, for there is next to no scientific library here and the few books worth consulting are scarcely accessible.

I saw in Feby. four fine examples of A. irritabilis in the Kew […], and have never seen any here so large — by the way the movement of the […]
check.
in the upper part of the resupinate labellum is one of mobility, not irritability.

You have no doubt long since received examples of the ferns brought from the north by Mr Hill in 1865; there was among them a certain Lindsoa which seems to be accepted at Kew as L. cultrata, which is no doubt its nearest ally, but it seems to me to differ from the Common East Indian fern in habit, in the crowded [pinnales], in the uniformly smaller stature, and in one or two other slight particulars which would make it at least a marked Australian var:

My favourite family is Glaminaceae, and if you have any duplicates of Southern & S. Western genera, particularly Pentapogon, Danthonia, Poa, Pappophorum, Tusaphis, Ectisia Panicum, Neurachne, Tsachne, Andropogon, Hierochlol, & Teh[…] verbena, except T. funcan, or any Algae, you would confer an obligation upon me, could you spare them.
I am of course much obliged by your offer of a regular correspondence, as I cannot fail to benefit by communication with so consummate a botanist.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
